item.title: And the River Will Grow
item.description: Elder Renlund and his family discuss the prophet Ezekiel's vision of the waters flowing from the house of the Lord. The river of water represents blessings, which flow from the temples to heal families and give them life.

item.title: One Work of Salvation, Part 5
item.description: Watch the story of Zayna Chubbs, a recent convert, prepare to attend the temple by learning about her family history and finding names of deceased family members.

item.title: Meet the Mormons
item.description: The Meet the Mormons movie examines the very diverse lives of six devout members of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints (Mormons). This video is for CHURCH or PERSONAL USE ONLY and is not to be uploaded or published to personal websites. However, we do encourage you to share the video from this page or embed it from YouTube.

item.title: General Women's Session
item.description: The General Women’s Session of the October 2015 General Conference.

item.title: Have I Done Any Good?
item.description: The choir and congregation sing “Have I Done Any Good?”

item.title: Hymn Medley
item.description: A combined Primary, Young Women, and Relief Society Choir from stakes in Salt Lake sings a medley of “I Am a Child of God” and “Love One Another.”

item.title: Cheryl A. Esplin
item.description: Sister Esplin teaches how to follow the Savior’s example of love and service.

item.title: Sweet Is the Work
item.description: The choir and congregation sing "Sweet Is The Work."

item.title: Neill F. Marriott
item.description: Sister Neill F. Marriott's address at the March 2016 General Women's Session

item.title: Linda K. Burton
item.description: Linda K. Burton encourages women to help refugees in their communities.

item.title: Come, Follow Me
item.description: A combined Primary, Young Women, and Relief Society Choir from stakes in Salt Lake sings “Come, Follow Me.”

item.title: Henry B. Eyring
item.description: President Eyring invites sisters to serve those in need, in the spirit of love and humility, trusting that God will prepare the way.

item.title: More Holiness Give Me
item.description: The choir and congregation sing “More Holiness Give Me.”

item.title: Saturday Morning Session
item.description: The Saturday Morning Session of the April 2016 General Conference.

item.title: How Wondrous and Great
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings, "How Wondrous and Great."

item.title: Come, Ye Children of the Lord
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings, "Come, Ye Children of the Lord."

item.title: I Feel My Savior's Love
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings, "I Feel My Savior's Love"

item.title: Henry B. Eyring
item.description: President Henry B. Eyring's address at the April 2016 general conference.

item.title: Mary R. Durham
item.description: Sister Durham teaches parents how to help their children feel and recognize the still, small voice of the Holy Ghost.

item.title: Donald L. Hallstrom
item.description: Elder Hallstrom teaches about the importance of knowing that God is the Father of our spirits.

item.title: Secret Prayer
item.description: The Choir and Congregation sing, "Secret Prayer."

item.title: Gary E. Stevenson
item.description: Elder Gary E. Sevenson's address at the April 2016 general conference.

item.title: Kevin R. Duncan
item.description: Elder Duncan teaches that if we turn to the Savior, He will heal us and help us to forgive those who injure us.

item.title: Steven E. Snow
item.description: Elder Steven E. Snow's address at the April 2016 general conference.

item.title: The Lord My Pasture Will Prepare
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings, "The Lord My Pasture Will Prepare."

item.title: Dale G. Renlund
item.description: Elder Renlund shows how drawing closer to God, particularly through the sacrament, can replace selfishness, entitlement, and skepticism with love and gratitude.

item.title: Come, Thou Fount of Every Blessing
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings, "Come, Thou Fount of Every Blessing."

item.title: Saturday Afternoon Session
item.description: The Saturday Afternoon Session of the April 2016 General Conference.

item.title: Sing Praise to Him
item.description: A Combined Choir from BYU-Idaho sings, "Sing Praise to Him."

item.title: The Sustaining of Church Officers
item.description: President Uchtdorf presents names of General Authorities and other Church leaders for sustaining vote; he also announces the release of various leaders.

item.title: Church Auditing Department Report, 2015
item.description: Church Auditing Department managing director Kevin R. Jergensen reads the auditing report for 2015.

item.title: Statistical Report, 2015
item.description: Brook P. Hales reads the statistical report for 2015.

item.title: Israel, Israel, God Is Calling
item.description: A Combined Choir from BYU-Idaho sings, "Israel, Israel, God Is Calling."

item.title: Ronald A. Rasband
item.description: Elder Rasband teaches that as we choose to follow the leaders of the Church we are following the Lord.

item.title: Neil L. Andersen
item.description: Elder Andersen counsels members to be thoughtful and sensitive regarding children and youth whose family life is not ideal.

item.title: Now Let Us Rejoice
item.description: The Choir and Congregation sing, "Now Let Us Rejoice."

item.title: Mervyn B. Arnold
item.description: Elder Mervyn B. Arnold's address at the April 2016 general conference.

item.title: Jairo Mazzagardi
item.description: Elder Mazzagardi tells of his conversion. He wondered how there could’ve been crowds of people in Palmyra in Joseph Smith’s time. He visits Palmyra.

item.title: David A. Bednar
item.description: Elder David A. Bednar's address at the April 2016 general conference.

item.title: M. Russell Ballard
item.description: Elder Ballard encourages members to follow a divine pattern by holding family councils, setting aside technology, and listening to one another.

item.title: I'll Go Where You Want Me to Go
item.description: A Combined Choir from BYU-Idaho sings, "I'll Go Where You Want Me to Go."

item.title: General Priesthood Session
item.description: The General Priesthood Session of the April 2016 General Conference.

item.title: In Hymns of Praise
item.description: A Priesthood Choir from Logan Institute of Religion sings, "In Hymns of Praise."

item.title: I Stand All Amazed
item.description: A Priesthood Choir from Logan Institute of Religion sings, "I Stand All Amazed."

item.title: Russell M. Nelson
item.description: President Nelson counsels the men and young men of the Church about how they can receive and use true priesthood power.

item.title: Stephen W. Owen
item.description: Stephen W. Owen teaches priesthood holders that in God's eyes, the greatest leaders—like Jesus Christ—have always been the greatest followers.

item.title: Come, O Thou King of Kings
item.description: The Choir and Congregation sing, "Come, O Thou King of Kings."

item.title: Dieter F. Uchtdorf
item.description: President Uchtdorf presents basic gospel principles that will help us preserve strong and happy marriages and families.

item.title: Henry B. Eyring
item.description: President Henry B. Eyring's address at the April 2016 general conference.

item.title: Thomas S. Monson
item.description: President Monson encourages priesthood holders to be worthy of the priesthood and prepared to use it to bless others.

item.title: Redeemer of Israel
item.description: A Priesthood Choir from Logan Institute of Religion sings, "Redeemer of Israel."

item.title: Sunday Morning Session
item.description: The Sunday Morning Session of the April 2016 General Conference.

item.title: Let Zion in Her Beauty Rise
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings, "Let Zion in Her Beauty Rise."

item.title: The Morning Breaks
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings, "The Morning Breaks."

item.title: I Will Follow God's Plan
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings, "I Will Follow God's Plan."

item.title: Thomas S. Monson
item.description: President Monson teaches about the importance of making good choices and of choosing to build faith within ourselves.

item.title: You Can Make the Pathway Bright
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings, "You Can Make the Pathway Bright."

item.title: Bonnie L. Oscarson
item.description: Sister Oscarson teaches that to believe in the Church means getting the gospel from our heads into our hearts so we will not be swayed by doubts and criticism.

item.title: W. Christopher Waddell
item.description: Bishop Waddell shares a pattern to help us find safety and peace: Learn of Christ, listen to His words, and walk in the meekness of His Spirit.

item.title: Rejoice, the Lord Is King!
item.description: The Choir and Congregation sing, "Rejoice, the Lord Is King!"

item.title: D. Todd Christofferson
item.description: Elder Christofferson speaks of the important role of fathers in society, in the family, and in Heavenly Father’s plan for His children.

item.title: Quentin L. Cook
item.description: Elder Cook encourages members to see themselves in the temple and to make any changes necessary to be able to participate in temple worship.

item.title: Dieter F. Uchtdorf
item.description: President Dieter F. Uchtdorf's address at the April 2016 General Conference.

item.title: O Thou Rock of Our Salvation
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings, "O Thou Rock of Our Salvation."

item.title: Sunday Afternoon Session
item.description: The Sunday Afternoon Session of the April 2016 General Conference.

item.title: Praise to the Lord, the Almighty
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings, "Praise to the Lord, the Almighty."

item.title: For I Am Called by Thy Name
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings, "For I Am Called by Thy Name."

item.title: Robert D. Hales
item.description: Elder Hales teaches us about the blessings and responsibilities associated with the gift of the Holy Ghost.

item.title: Gerrit W. Gong
item.description: Elder Gong gives six suggestions for how we can better fulfill our covenant to always remember the Savior.

item.title: Patrick Kearon
item.description: Elder Kearon recounts the service of Church members to refugees and encourages members to continue to help.

item.title: Guide Us, O Thou Great Jehovah
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings, "Guide Us, O Thou Great Jehovah."

item.title: Dallin H. Oaks
item.description: Elder Oaks teaches how various forms of opposition in mortality help to further our growth.

item.title: Kent F. Richards
item.description: Elder Richards teaches that the power of godliness comes to us through the covenants and ordinances of the temple.

item.title: Paul V. Johnson
item.description: Elder Johnson tells of his daughter who passed away from cancer. He testifies of the reality of the Savior’s Resurrection and the Resurrection of all mankind.

item.title: The Day Dawn Is Breaking
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings, "The Day Dawn Is Breaking."

item.title: Jeffrey R. Holland
item.description: Elder Holland encourages Church members to do the best they can to live the gospel and testifies that God's love and help will be with them.

item.title: Sing We Now at Parting
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings, "Sing We Now at Parting."

item.title: Working Together in Love and Unity
item.description: "It is the love of God and neighbor that gives meaning to life."—Sister Cheryl A. Esplin, "He Asks Us to Be His Hands" "Love is making space in your life for someone else."—Sister Neill F. Marriott, "What Shall We Do?" "When we work together in love and unity we can expect heaven's help."—Sister Linda K. Burtoner, "I Was a Stranger"

item.title: Draw Closer to the Savior
item.description: "Draw closer to the Savior as we out of pure love serve others for Him."—President Henry B. Eyring, "Trust in That Spirit Which Leadeth to Do Good"

item.title: Listen with the Spirit
item.description: "If you listen with the spirit you will find your heart softened, and your faith strengthened, and your capacity to love the Lord increased."—President Henry B. Eyring, "Where Two or Three Are Gathered"

item.title: He Will Not Leave Us
item.description: "The Lord has shown us that He will not leave us standing in the bitter cold, without keys or authority to lead us safely home to Him."—Elder Gary E. Stevenson, "Where Are the Keys and Authority of the Priesthood?"

item.title: We All Receive More Than We Deserve
item.description: "Our present circumstances may not change but through God's compassion, kindness, and love, we will all receive more than we deserve."—Elder Dale G. Renlund, "That I Might Draw All Men Unto Me"

item.title: We Need One Another
item.description: "When we reach out to lift one another, we prove those powerful words: "no one goes his way alone."—Elder Ronald A. Rasband, "Standing with the Leaders of the Church"

item.title: Your True Identity
item.description: "While a child's earthly situation may not be ideal a child's spiritual DNA is perfect, because one's true identity is as a son or daughter of God."—Elder Neil L. Andersen, "Whoso Receiveth Them, Receiveth Me"

item.title: Ordinances Invite Spiritual Purpose
item.description: "Ordinances invite spiritual purpose and power into our lives as we strive to be born again and become men and women of Christ."—Elder David A. Bednar, "Always Retain a Remission of Your Sins"

item.title: What Children Need
item.description: "Children desperately need parents willing to listen to them."—Elder M. Russell Ballard, "Family Councils"

item.title: Increase Our Access to His Power
item.description: "If we will humbly present ourselves before the Lord and asked Him to teach us He will show us how to increase our access to His power."—President Russell M. Nelson, "The Price of Priesthood Power"

item.title: Building Great Marriages
item.description: "Great marriages are built brick by brick, day after day, over a lifetime."—President Dieter F. Uchtdorf, "In Praise of Those Who Save"

item.title: No More Important Commitment
item.description: "There is no more important commitment in time or in eternity than marriage."—President Henry B. Eyring, "Eternal Families"

item.title: A Child of Promise
item.description: "You are a child of promise. You are a man of might. You are a son of God."—President Thomas S. Monson, "A Sacred Trust"

item.title: Choose the Harder Right
item.description: "May we maintain the courage to defy the consensus. May we ever choose the harder right, instead of the easier wrong."—President Thomas S. Monson, "Choices"

item.title: The Best Things a Father Can Do
item.description: "Loving the mother of his children and showing that love are the two best things a father can do for his children."—Elder D. Todd Christofferson, "Fathers"

item.title: Living Righteous Principles
item.description: "Living righteous principles will bring you and your family happiness, fulfillment, and peace."—Elder Quentin L. Cook, "See Yourself in the Temple"

item.title: Hope to Believe
item.description: "If you cannot say you know God is there you can hope that He is. You can desire to believe. That is enough to start."—President Dieter F. Uchtdorf, "He Will Place You on His Shoulders and Carry You Home"

item.title: The Medium for God’s Work
item.description: "The Holy Ghost is the medium for God's work, in families and throughout the Church."—Elder Robert D. Hales, "The Holy Ghost"

item.title: Working Together in Love and Unity
item.description: "It is the love of God and neighbor that gives meaning to life."—Sister Cheryl A. Esplin, "He Asks Us to Be His Hands" "Love is making space in your life for someone else."—Sister Neill F. Marriott, "What Shall We Do?" "When we work together in love and unity we can expect heaven's help."—Sister Linda K. Burtoner, "I Was a Stranger"

item.description: "Draw closer to the Savior as we out of pure love serve others for Him."—President Henry B. Eyring, "Trust in That Spirit Which Leadeth to Do Good"

item.description: "If you listen with the spirit you will find your heart softened, and your faith strengthened, and your capacity to love the Lord increased."—President Henry B. Eyring, "Where Two or Three Are Gathered"

item.description: "The Lord has shown us that He will not leave us standing in the bitter cold, without keys or authority to lead us safely home to Him."—Elder Gary E. Stevenson, "Where Are the Keys and Authority of the Priesthood?"

item.description: "If we will humbly present ourselves before the Lord and asked Him to teach us He will show us how to increase our access to His power."—President Russell M. Nelson, "The Price of Priesthood Power"

item.description: "Great marriages are built brick by brick, day after day, over a lifetime."—President Dieter F. Uchtdorf, "In Praise of Those Who Save"

item.description: "There is no more important commitment in time or in eternity than marriage."—President Henry B. Eyring, "Eternal Families"

item.description: "You are a child of promise. You are a man of might. You are a son of God."—President Thomas S. Monson, "A Sacred Trust"

item.description: "May we maintain the courage to defy the consensus. May we ever choose the harder right, instead of the easier wrong."—President Thomas S. Monson, "Choices"

item.description: "Loving the mother of his children and showing that love are the two best things a father can do for his children."—Elder D. Todd Christofferson, "Fathers"

item.title: Living Righteous Principles
item.description: "Living righteous principles will bring you and your family happiness, fulfillment, and peace."—Elder Quentin L. Cook, "See Yourself in the Temple"

item.description: "If you cannot say you know God is there you can hope that He is. You can desire to believe. That is enough to start."—President Dieter F. Uchtdorf, "He Will Place You on His Shoulders and Carry You Home"

item.title: The Medium for God’s Work
item.description: "The Holy Ghost is the medium for God's work, in families and throughout the Church."—Elder Robert D. Hales, "The Holy Ghost"

item.title: Equally Yoked Together
item.description: President Boyd K. Packer uses the story of oxen being equally yoked together to teach principles of teamwork in education.

item.title: Emergency Response Volunteer Training
item.description: Wards and stakes may organize volunteers to assist in the community following a disaster. All volunteers should adhere to Church safety guidelines for disaster cleanup.

item.title: I Was a Stranger—Invite a Refugee to Dinner
item.description: Milan and her daughters are refugees from Bhutan. Michelle and her family meet them and invite them over to cook dinner together and learn about each other’s culture.

item.title: Teaching the Gospel Website
item.description: The members of the Sunday School general presidency—Brother Russell T. Osguthorpe, Brother David M. McConkie, and Brother Matthew O. Richardson—come together to discuss the Teaching the Gospel website.

item.title: Teach People, Not Lessons
item.description: The Sunday School general presidency—Russell T. Osguthorpe, David M. McConkie, and Matthew O. Richardson—comes together to discuss teaching the gospel.

item.title: Prepare Spiritually
item.description: The Sunday School general presidency—Russell T. Osguthorpe, David M. McConkie, and Matthew O. Richardson—discusses how teachers can better prepare for lessons.

item.title: New Teachers
item.description: The Sunday School general presidency discusses how teachers can better prepare for lessons.

item.title: Teaching the Gospel Website
item.description: The members of the Sunday School general presidency—Russell T. Osguthorpe, David M. McConkie, and Matthew O. Richardson—come together to discuss the Teaching the Gospel website. They also discuss how teachers can better prepare for lessons.

item.title: Teaching around the World
item.description: The members of the Sunday School general presidency—Russell T. Osguthorpe, David M. McConkie, and Matthew O. Richardson—talk about their experiences teaching the gospel throughout the world.

item.title: To Shake a Prophet's Hand
item.description: The Sunday School general presidency talks about their experiences teaching the gospel throughout the world.

item.title: Help Is on the Way
item.description: The Sunday School general presidency—Russell T. Osguthorpe, David M. McConkie, and Matthew O. Richardson—come together to talk about their experiences teaching the gospel throughout the world.

item.title: Help the Lost Sheep
item.description: The Sunday School general presidency comes together to talk about their experiences teaching the gospel throughout the world.

item.title: Hunger for Knowledge
item.description: The members of the Sunday School general presidency come together to talk about their experiences teaching the gospel around the world.

item.title: How Do You Suppose I Know of These Things?
item.description: The members of the Sunday School general presidency—Russell T. Osguthorpe, David M. McConkie, and Matthew O. Richardson—come together to talk about their experiences teaching the gospel around the world.

item.title: Teaching around the World
item.description: The members of the Sunday School general presidency—Brother Russell T. Osguthorpe, Brother David M. McConkie, and Brother Matthew O. Richardson—come together to talk about their experiences teaching the gospel throughout the world.

item.title: Diligent Learners
item.description: Brother Osguthorpe asks Elder Bednar how we can be diligent learners.

item.title: Acting and Not Being Acted Upon
item.description: Elder Bednar says that the best teachers invite their students to act upon what they're learning.

item.title: Fear Not Silence
item.description: Elder Bednar says that the Holy Ghost is the teacher. Teachers should give students time to ponder and let the Holy Ghost teach them.

item.title: Create Your Own Small Plates
item.description: Elder Bednar says, "If all we get is what the teacher presents, we're missing what matters most."

item.title: Create a Pattern of Acting
item.description: Elder Bednar says effective teaching is listening and observing so you can discern what the Holy Ghost wants you to teach.

item.title: The Holy Ghost is the Teacher
item.description: Brother Osguthorpe and Elder Bednar discuss how the Holy Ghost is the real teacher.

item.title: The Importance of Teaching in the Gospel, part 1
item.description: Brother Russell T. Osguthorpe, Sunday School general president, interviews Elder David A. Bednar of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles.

item.title: Inviting Learners to Act
item.description: Brother Osguthorpe asks Elder Bednar how teachers can get students involved.

item.title: Honor People's Agency
item.description: Elder Bednar says teachers must honor students' agency. The Holy Ghost carries a message unto their hearts. The learners have to act in faith in order to get the message into their hearts.

item.title: I Have Learned for Myself
item.description: Elder Bednar discusses how we, like Joseph Smith, can learn for ourselves that the Gospel is true.

item.title: Elder David A. Bednar's Desire to Learn
item.description: Elder Bednar talks about how he gained such a strong desire to learn about the Gospel.

item.title: Motivate
item.description: Brother Osguthorpe asks Elder Bednar how teachers can motivate their students.

item.title: Help Me Understand
item.description: Elder Bednar says, "Inviting learners to act... is the highest manifestation of teaching."

item.title: The Importance of Teaching in the Gospel, part 2
item.description: This is the second episode in which Brother Russell T. Osguthorpe, Sunday School general president, interviews Elder David A. Bednar of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles.

category.title: Bible Videos - The Life of Jesus Christ
category.subtitle: Videos: 3

item.title: Reconciled to God
item.description: The gospel reconciles man to God. Reference: 2 Corinthians 5:17-21

item.title: The Apostasy and Restoration
item.description: Paul forewarns of the apostasy that will precede the Second Coming of the Lord.

item.title: Resurrection of the Dead
item.description: Paul teaches of the Resurrection of the Dead. Reference: 1 Cor. 15: 20-26

item.title: Fasting: Philippines Widow
item.description: A widow in the Philippines shows great faith while fasting and donating a fast offering.

item.title: Fasting: Romania, Paun Family
item.description: A father in Romania teaches his daughter about the importance of fasting and donating a generous fast offering, even when you dont have much.

item.title: Fasting: Young Single Adult Ward, Amanda
item.description: Amanda, a young single adult attending a YSA ward in Los Angeles, talks about how fasting plays a part in her life.

item.title: Fasting: Simi Valley Widow
item.description: A California widow explains how fast offerings helped her in a time of need—and how important it is that she donates a generous fast offering now.

item.title: Welfare Facilities - Home Storage Center
item.description: Food storage can help in times of trouble. To assist in building food storage, the LDS Church has 100 home storage centers throughout the United States and Canada. The Church also has an online store that allows anyone to purchase food storage items.

item.title: Emergency Response Volunteer Training
item.description: Wards and stakes may organize volunteers to assist in the community following a disaster. All volunteers should adhere to Church safety guidelines for disaster cleanup.

item.title: Becoming Strong in the Lord
item.description: Quote given by Elder Robert D. Hales in the Priesthood session on April 6, 2013.

item.title: Poster: Wish You Were Here
item.description: Poster: Wish You Were Here

item.title: Poster: Wish You Were Here
item.description: Poster: Wish You Were Here

item.title: Look Forward to Your Future
item.description: President Boyd K. Packer speaks at the 2011 October General Conference.

item.title: Courage to Stand Alone
item.description: President Thomas S. Monson speaks at the 2011 October General Conference.

item.title: Be a Covenant Keeper
item.description: Elder Russell M. Nelson speaks at the 2011 October General Conference.

item.title: Your Wonderful Journey Home
item.description: Statement by By President Dieter F. Uchtdorf in the general Young Women meeting on March 30, 2013.

item.title: Personal Peace: The Reward of Righteousness
item.description: Quote given by Elder Quentin L. Cook in the Saturday afternoon on April 6, 2013.

item.title: Becoming Strong in the Lord
item.description: Quote given by Elder Robert D. Hales in the Priesthood session on April 6, 2013.
